name: Key West Harbor Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do stay @ Harbor Inn if you want: Short walk to Duval, Mallory Square, Land & water tours, local restaurants and food stands, Key Lime pie within 20 steps....secure premises with an assortment of shade palms surrounding a good-sized pool area with lounge chairs, and sitting chairs & tables and gazebos to choose from; outdoor shower and bath. An historical inn with a cottage or two with various sitting porches and an assortment of rooms to suit your size desire; clean inside and out and continually so. Continental help yourself breakfast and a decently stocked late afternoon happy hour with snacks. Bike rental on site and/or small space to park them. Exceptionally friendly and helpful staff.
reviews.title: Do's and Don'ts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't stay if you are not satisfied with a good assortment of cereals, bread, muffins, juices, hot coffee/tea available for over two hours in the morning to come and go as you please. Don't consider this place if you can't stand a comfy bed, good shower heads and pressure, fluffy towels, and pool and beach towels available to you. Please look elsewhere if you need a bell hop to carry your overpacked bags (but fellow guests are glad to help if you need it - unless you can't stand random acts of kindness by the clientele this type of inn attracts). It's find your own parking (sorry no valet, darling) and once you HAVE the coveting "spot" - Park It - and use your legs to wallk or bike since everything is close (it's only 2 miles wide afterall and location here is key). Just move on if smiling, polite hellos and friendly conversation with the staff (or other guests) rub you the wrong way.
reviews.title: What a wonderful holiday destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just the facts....we stayed in one of the smaller rooms on the second floor of the inn. We found the St John room was perfectly fine for two (but we like each other). If you need some space from your other, there is always a wrap-around porch steps from your door with plenty of seating or you could always just go float in the pool 24-7. The porch was great to listen to local music at night or the doves "whoing" in the morning. No coffee maker or refer in this room FYI - but plently of coffee/drink during morning and afternoon available anyway; another option only a block away (to the rear of property) is a great local coffee house/bakery; almost as close in the other direction is cuban coffee (and a really good cuban mix sandwich) and a liquor store with really big refer's to quench your thirst if you need an endless happy hour. The bath was spacious, big tiled shower, well lighted. Be forewarned if one of your carry-on's is totally cosmetics, you'll have a tough time in this bath (could maybe use a shelf) - we just hung our bath travel bag on the towel rack, it worked fine. Please leave the mascara home - this is an island, go naked (but please don't sit on Tracy's chairs....). Room was cleaned beautifully each day, towel animals and everything (the swans don't really float, but they make pretty nice pool towels). Good sized closet with safe, two bed-side tables with a drawer; we just kept all in luggage, besides, how much room do bathing suits and t-shirts take? Other guests were considerate (no loud voices or door slamming) and overall the inn was very quiet (still nicely socialble during morning/happy hour). Nice guests....even nicer staff.
reviews.title: Perfect Key West Location and Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay in B & B's frequently in our travels and extensive roadtrips; from historic 4 course elegance to wooded rustic on the river; Key West Harbor Inn suited the KW atmosphere; "Don't worry - be happy". Thanks to all there...we were.
reviews.title: Perfect location, perfect setting for Key West

reviews.text: We were recommended this inn by a good friend who has stayed there on a number of occasions. it was our first trip to key west and we were not disapointed the staff are wonderful especially the manager Tracey, who really went out of her way to make us feel welcome. Her staff are wonderful nothing was too much trouble to them. The Inn is located within easy walking distance of anywhere you may want to go and the harbour was enchanting. We stayed in the King Suite and this was like our own little bungalow. It was spacious and very comfortable, and it had a large bathroom. We loved this room The courtyard/pool area can only be described as charming. There was a happy hour each afternoon with tasty snacks and a fully stocked bar (Tiki Bar) as well as different alcoholic punch each day. Breakfast was unhurried and we liked that we were not rushed and it included delicious fresh fruit. We will be returning and will be sure to stay with Tracey and her staff again. We would have no hestiation in reccomending this as a place to stay when your in Key West to everyone
reviews.title: My Best Place to Stay in Key West!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary with a trip to Key West in September. We booked the Harbor Inn because of the location and the price (stayed in the CURACAO room). We don't usually spend much time at the hotel wherever we travel but were surprised when we found ourselves chatting with Tracy, enjoying the free drinks and swimming in the pool every day. The room was small (we live in NYC so no biggie) but was very comfortable, private and clean. The grounds and staff were amazing and l love how it felt like an oasis but was so close to everything. This place is the whole package that I would suggest to anyone visiting KW!
reviews.title: Perfect location, great staff, loved our stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree completely with Linda A who wrote that this is the best place to stay in Key West. My wife and I go down for the lighted boat parade every Christmas, and would never stay anywhere else. The rooms are comfortable, the staff is extremely friendly, and the location is the best. There is limited free parking on the street out front which you can get if you're patient, or there is a parking garage nearby. Park your car somewhere, and forget about it until it's time to leave. It's a short walk from the Key West Express ferry, or a taxi ride from the airport. We've become friends with everyone and other guests over the years, and would never consider staying anywhere else.
reviews.title: Best Inn in Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This charming Inn has everything going for it - First a wonderful location just the right distance from everything. The property is tucked away behind a locked gate with wonderful gardens. Second, an amazing staff who do an incredible job at making guests happy and maintaining the property. Traci far exceeds the quality of an hotel manager I have ever met. Her advice of what to do on our first visit made the trip an incredible one. Third, are the little perks - the wonderful breakfast (I miss the delicious fresh cut fruit!), fun happy hour, and refrigerator in the room. (Pool however did not feel warm enough to swim in) It is really a special place and one that you can tell is loved and well cared for by the owner. And the Christmas Decorations were so much fun!
reviews.title: Location, Staff, and Perks...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our visit to the KWHI. We have stayed here at least 10 times and would not stay anywhere else in KW. This time the ground were decorated for Christmas and it was so beautiful. The location in convienent to the best spots in KW. The only downside to parking that is a challenge anywhere on the Island, but truthfully you don't really need to have a car since everything is either walking distance or a quick bicycle ride away.
reviews.title: Best Inn in Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great breakfast every morning and Happy hour by the pool every afternoon. We love mingling with the other guest. We have gotten good ideas of things to do and places to eat in the area from these gathering.
reviews.title: Second Stay - Second Thumbs Up !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in the Summer. Really enjoyed it, loved the happy hour each day. Great location and liked the vouchers the b and b provided for nearby restaurants. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We couldn't be happier with our choice to stay at the Harbor Inn, Key West. We were a very short walk from the excitment from the Famous Duval Street and all it has to offer as well as a stones throw from the Marina. Yet once you walk threw the iron gate into the Inn's property, you'd never know it; as you will find yourself in a tropical paradise. The staff couldn't be anymore friendly and helpful; it shows that they take pride in every aspect of their jobs. You'll wake up to a lovely breakfast spread and will be able to enjoy it with fellow travelers in a lush atmosphere by the pool. Happy hour is just as fun with the new friends you'll make that are staying there. If coming back is in my future, that's where you'll find me.
reviews.title: Private Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I thouroughy enjoyed our four day stay at the Haror Inn. Although we had a car, we did not move it once we were able to find a parking spot in front of the Inn. The harbor, Mallory Square, Duval Street were all within easy walking distance as were many restaurants and bars. Included with the room was a daily happy hour, drinks and lite snacks were provided and a substantial continental breakfast was served in the patio area. Although the room we had (Aruba) on the small side, it was comfortable enough. We made good use of the minifridge but the area could have used a trash can.There was only room for a bedside stand and light on one side of the bed and although there were several windows, I found the lighting a bit dim.However,the room was very nicely decorated and spotlessly clean. All the staff were extremly friendly and helpful as was Leonardo, the owner. This was our first trip to Key West and we will most likely not return as we live on the west coast but I would not hesitate to recommend the KWHI to all .
reviews.title: Best Key West location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my wife and I third trip to Key West and our first stay at KWHI. We chose the location because of reviews just like this. The "bight" or harbor is one of the most popular locations for visitors to Key West and can be seen from the upper decks of the inn. All of the favorite restaurants and bars that you read about are there, A&B, Schooners Wharf, Half Shell Oyster Bar, Turtle Krawls and more. All within a short enjoyable walk. All of the reviews that I had read were correct. From the owner to every member of the staff, everyone was very helpful. We stayed in the Tobago which is on the second floor overlooking the pool. Very nice room. The bed is a bit large for the room so you have to watch your toes, but, the plus is that the bed is a very comfortable king size. The rooms are cleaned meticulously every day and the cleaning staff watch you to make sure that they do not disturb you. I really liked the large open tiled shower because the shower head comes from above instead of the conventional wall location.
reviews.title: Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The A/C unit is great and super quiet and keeps the room very comfortable. The grounds and pool area are always neat and clean. Being as close to all of the action as you are you will not be bothered by noises from the harbor. The only thing that caught my attention was a daily "conch blowing" contest which was entertaining.
reviews.title: Perfect Paradise
Cozy oasis
reviews.text: Charming historic inn set in lovely little tropical garden. We felt well cared for with the light breakfast buffet and good happy hour each day. Very pleased with St Thomas room, with two breezy windows and door to balcony. (booked many months in advance during for high season stay). Clean, good shower and nice closet. We could hear laughter from the nearby harbor restaurants but not loud enough to bother us. It was our first trip to KW but several other guests have come back to the inn year after year. We would stay again there too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second time staying there, and like the first time it was great, very relaxing. We were very lucky the Inn was booked when we wanted to go down there, but after checking in at the Crowne Plaz.... we went for a walk, saw there was vacancy at the Inn. We went in and asked why the vacancy, Well the snow storm kept the couple from comming down, so there was a room available. I payed for an early check out at the plaza, and checked in for three days of heaven. beyond five stars
reviews.title: HEAVEN

reviews.text: What a wonderful vacation spot. I stayed in the Martinique room & was pleasantly surprised. This was my first vacation at a B&B but this Inn is more like a mini hotel with the best amenities. Tracey & her wonderful staff were very friendly & helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in the Martinique Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was beautifully appointed in a cheery yellow tropical style. The bed was comfy & many pillows were provided. The room was very clean and as proof I walked around in my white socks for a full day on the wood floors & to my amazement they were fairly clean. Okay, so it doesn't take much to entertain me. I did have a closet that contained a safe, ironing board & iron (which I never would of used).
reviews.title: The St. Croix: a room with no closet and very little else, too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast & happy hour bar in the lush pool area was much more than I expected. The rum punch was to die for & the fellow travelers & staff were fun to sit & chat with.
reviews.title: Great times

aka: Key West Harbor Hotel Key West
